indicators.name: Gross value added per hour worked
indicators.longdesc: Measure of business productivity (estimate of the volume of goods and services produced) in Â£ per hour worked

indicators.name: Gross median weekly pay
indicators.longdesc: Average (median) weekly pay, based on where people live

indicators.name: Employment rate for 16 to 64 year olds
indicators.longdesc: Proportion of people aged between 16 and 64 years in paid work or who had a job that they were temporarily away from

indicators.name: Public transport or walk to employment centre with 500 to 4999 jobs
indicators.longdesc: Average travel time in minutes to nearest employment centre with 500 to 4999 jobs available by public transport or walking

indicators.name: Drive to employment centre with 500 to 4999 jobs
indicators.longdesc: Average travel time in minutes to nearest employment centre with 500 to 4999 jobs available by car

indicators.name: Cycle to employment centre with 500 to 4999 jobs
indicators.longdesc: Average travel time in minutes to nearest employment centre with 500 to 49099 jobs available by cycle

indicators.name: Apprenticeships starts
indicators.longdesc: Apprenticeships started by adults aged 16+ based on home address, rate per 100,000

indicators.name: Apprenticeships achievements
indicators.longdesc: Apprenticeships achieved by adults aged 16+ based on home address, rate per 100,000

indicators.name: Gross disposable household income per head
indicators.longdesc: Estimate of the amount of money each individual within a household has available for spending or saving after they have paid taxes and received any direct benefits

indicators.name: Total value of UK exports
indicators.longdesc: Estimated total value of UK exports including trade in both goods and services

indicators.name: Inward foreign direct investment (FDI)
indicators.longdesc: Total foreign FDI international investment position in the UK at end period

indicators.name: Outward foreign direct investment (FDI)
indicators.longdesc: Total FDI international investment position abroad at end period

indicators.name: Gigabit capable broadband
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of premises with 125 megabytes (MB) or greater

indicators.name: 4G coverage
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of geographic areas with 4G signal outdoors from at least 1 operator (signal threshold: 105dBm)

indicators.name: Pupils at expected standards by end of primary school
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of pupils in state-funded schools meeting the expected standard in reading, writing and maths by end of primary school (KS2)

indicators.name: GCSEs (and equivalent) in English and maths by age 19
indicators.longdesc: GCSEs (and equivalent) in English and maths by age 19

indicators.name: Schools and nursery schools rated good or outstanding
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of state-funded Nursery schools, Primary schools, Secondary schools, Alternative Provision (AP) schools and Special schools that are rated 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by OFSTED

indicators.name: Persistent absences for all pupils
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of pupils in state-funded schools that were persistently absent (those absent for 10% of schooling sessions) during the academic year

indicators.name: Persistent absences for pupils eligible for free school meals
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of pupils in state-funded schools who have been eligible for free school meals in the past 6 years that were persistently absent (those absent for 10% of schooling sessions) during the academic year

indicators.name: Persistent absences for pupils looked after by local authorities
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of pupils in state-funded schools who are looked after continuously by local authorities that were persistnetly absent (those absent for 10% of schooling sessions) during the academic year. These pupils have been looked after for at least 12 months as of 31 March 2022

indicators.name: Children at expected standard for communication and language by end of early years foundation stage
indicators.longdesc: Early years foundation stage profile outcomes of 5 year olds. Percentage at 'expected level' across all communication and language learning goals

indicators.name: Children at expected standard for literacy by end of early years foundation stage
indicators.longdesc: Early years foundation stage profile outcomes of 5 year olds. Percentage at 'expected level' across all literacy learning goals

indicators.name: Children at expected standard for maths by end of early years foundation stage
indicators.longdesc: Early years foundation stage profile outcomes of 5 year olds. Percentage at 'expected level' across all mathematics learning goals

indicators.name: Aged 19 years and over further education and skills learner achievements
indicators.longdesc: Count of learners achieving a funded further education and skills learning aim, with the exception of community learning

indicators.name: Aged 16 to 64 years level 3 or above qualifications
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of the population aged 16-64 with National Vocational Qualification (NVQ) level 3+ qualifications

indicators.name: Aged 19 years and over further education and skills participation
indicators.longdesc: 19+ further education and skills participation rate per 100,000 people

indicators.name: Female healthy life expectancy
indicators.longdesc: Average years expected to be lived in good health for females born during the reference period

indicators.name: Male healthy life expectancy
indicators.longdesc: Average years expected to be lived in good health for males born during the reference period

indicators.name: Cigarette smokers
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of adults (18+) people who state they currently smoke cigarettes (excluding e-cigarettes)

indicators.name: Overweight children at reception age (aged four to five years)
indicators.longdesc: Proportion of children aged 4-5 years classified as overweight or obese. Children are classified as overweight (including obese) if their BMI is on or above the 85th centile of the British 1990 growth reference (UK90) according to age and sex.
indicators.source: Office for Health Improvement and Disparities

indicators.name: Overweight children at Year 6 age (aged 10 to 11 years)
indicators.longdesc: Proportion of children aged 10-11 classified as overweight or obese. Children are classified as overweight (including obese) if their BMI is on or above the 85th centile of the British 1990 growth reference (UK90) according to age and sex.
indicators.source: Office for Health Improvement and Disparities

indicators.name: Overweight adults (aged 18 years and over)
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of adults aged 18 and over classified as overweight or obese
indicators.source: Office for Health Improvement and Disparities

indicators.name: Cancers diagnosed at stage 1 and 2
indicators.longdesc: New cases of cancer diagnosed at stages 1 and 2 as a percentage of all new cases of cancer diagnosed at any known stage
indicators.source: Office for Health Improvement and Disparities

indicators.name: Cardiovascular mortality considered preventable in persons aged under 75
indicators.longdesc: Age-standardised mortality rate from cardiovascular diseases considered preventble for those aged under 75 per 100,000 people (2019 definition)
indicators.source: Office for Health Improvement and Disparities

indicators.name: Life satisfaction
indicators.longdesc: The average rating of those that feel satisfied about their lives for adults aged 16 years and over

indicators.name: Feeling life is worthwhile
indicators.longdesc: The average rating of those that feel the thiings they do in life are worthwhile for adults aged 16 years and over

indicators.name: Happiness
indicators.longdesc: The average rating of those that felt happy yesterday for adults aged 16 years and over

indicators.name: Anxiety
indicators.longdesc: The average rating of those that felt anxious yesterday for adults aged 16 years and over

indicators.name: Additions to the housing stock
indicators.longdesc: Net additions to the dweling stock (including new builds, conversions, changes of use, other gains/losses and offset by demolitions) per 1,000 stock
indicators.source: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

indicators.name: Homicide Offences
indicators.longdesc: Rate of Homicide offences per million population

indicators.name: Population under devolution deal in England
indicators.longdesc: Percentage of the population living in an area covered by the highest level of devolution in England
